meanings.definition: To have as belonging to one; own.
meanings.sent2: She possesses a beautiful singing voice.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it possesses the house.
meanings.sent4: His eyes possess a captivating sparkle.
meanings.sent5: The old book possesses a mysterious aura.

meanings.definition: To have as a characteristic, quality, or attribute.
meanings.sent2: The flower possesses a lovely fragrance.
meanings.sent3: The clown believes he possesses magical powers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile possesses an infectious joy.
meanings.sent5: The painting possesses a sense of tranquility.

meanings.definition: To have in one's power or control.
meanings.sent2: The magician possesses the ability to disappear.
meanings.sent3: The child pretends to possess superhuman strength.
meanings.sent4: The storm possesses the power to cause destruction.
meanings.sent5: The villain possesses a cunning mind.
